To limit users to only individual department forms and views, you should use security roles. Security roles in a CRM or similar system allow you to control what records and features users can access based on their assigned role. This is a common practice for segregating access within an organization and ensuring that users only have access to the information and functionalities relevant to their responsibilities.

The other options, while relevant to managing user access and customization, might not directly address the need to restrict users to specific department forms and views

You can achieve the goal of limiting users to individual department forms and views by creating separate model-driven apps for each department in Dynamics 365 Sales. Model-driven apps allow you to tailor the user experience by presenting specific forms, views, and functionalities to different user groups.

The best option to ensure that estimated revenue for opportunities is automatically calculated in Dynamics 365 for Sales is:

A. In the System Settings sales tab, change the default revenue type to System Calculated

This is because the System Settings sales tab controls the default behavior for all users in the system. Changing the default revenue type to System Calculated here will ensure that estimated revenue is automatically calculated for all opportunities, unless manually overridden by a sales representative. The other options (B, C, D) are not as likely to resolve this specific issue. Therefore, option A is the most effective solution.
